thread.section_title: KTOO - News & Public Media from Alaska's Capital -
thread.title: Southeast Archives - KTOO

author: Jack Darrell; KRBD
title: Southeast Archives - KTOO
text: The majority of the public boat harbors in Alaska were constructed and funded by the state during the 1960s and 1970s. Over the last 30 years, those state subsidies have dried up. Southeast [Offshore magnitude 5.9 earthquake rattles Southeast Alaska](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/12/offshore-magnitude-5-9-earthquake-rattles-southeast-alaska/) Houses shook briefly in Sitka, Petersburg and Wrangell. [Improvements could help Five Finger Island’s lighthousekeepers stay for a longer season](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/11/improvements-could-help-five-finger-islands-lighthousekeepers-stay-for-a-longer-season/) Every summer, the remote lighthouse draws in scores of visitors who want to learn more about the unique history and ecology of Five Finger Island. [2 dead, 3 rescued after boating accident north of Sitka](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/10/2-dead-3-rescued-after-boating-accident-north-of-sitka/) The boat capsized near Chichagof Island on Tuesday night. [Paralytic shellfish poisoning toxin is high in some subsistence harvests, according to Knik Tribe’s data](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/08/paralytic-shellfish-poisoning-toxin-is-high-in-some-subsistence-harvests-according-to-knik-tribes-data/) Shellfish harvests even a quarter-mile away from each other might have very different levels of the PSP toxin. [Petersburg Christmas Bird Count records highest number of birds in recent memory](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/08/petersburg-christmas-bird-count-records-highest-number-of-birds-in-recent-memory/) The group also spotted an exceptional number of species. [Salmon compete with mining companies as melting glaciers reveal new habitat](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/05/salmon-glacial-retreat-transboundary-mining/) A recent study warns that outdated laws in Canada and Southeast Alaska don’t do enough to protect salmon habitat as climate change transforms the landscape. [State’s high court rules against Sitka Tribe of Alaska’s herring claim](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/04/states-high-court-rules-against-sitka-tribe-of-alaskas-herring-claim/) The Sitka Tribe of Alaska first sued the state in 2018, alleging that the commercial fishery management put herring stocks and traditional harvesting in jeopardy. [Sealaska Heritage Institute seeks art for this year’s Celebration](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/03/sealaska-heritage-institute-seeks-art-for-this-years-celebration/) Artists have until Jan. 12 to pitch design concepts for “Together we live in balance.” [Scientists and townspeople rescued 2 orcas trapped in a Southeast Alaska lake](https://www.ktoo.org/2024/01/03/scientists-and-townspeople-rescued-2-orcas-trapped-in-a-southeast-alaska-lake/) The killer whales were in danger of starving, and they couldn’t get out on their own. It took a team of scientists and nearly half of Coffman Cove to save them.
